qas.question: What two groups are bound by a "Safe Harbor" agreement?
In exchange for altering the property to a more beneficial state, what does the landowner gain from the Safe Harbor agreement?

answers.text: assurances that the FWS will permit future "takes" above a pre-determined level

qas.question: Which presidential administration developed Safe Harbor policy?
Are Safe Harbor agreements and ITPs mutually exclusive?

answers.text: A landowner can have either a "Safe Harbor" agreement or an Incidental Take Permit, or both.

qas.question: What provision is the ITP under?
When did FWS create the Safe Harbor agreement?
What form of agreement can a landowner no longer have if they acquire an ITP?
What provision relies on the Safe Harbor agreement?

context: <b6_0>The "Safe Harbor" agreement<b6_0/> is a voluntary agreement between <a0_0>the private landowner and FWS<a0_0/>. The landowner agrees to alter the property to benefit or even attract a listed or proposed species in exchange for <a1_0>assurances that the FWS will permit future "takes" above a pre-determined level<a1_0/>. The policy relies on <b7_0>the "enhancement of survival"<b7_0/> provision of <b4_0>Section §1539(a)(1)(A)<b4_0/>. <a3_0>A landowner can have either a "Safe Harbor" agreement or an Incidental Take Permit, or both.<a3_0/> The policy was developed by <a2_0><b8_0>the Clinton Administration<b8_0/><a2_0/> in <b5_0>1999<b5_0/>.
